<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To find the named of the imported DLL from an import library, we can either</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// inspect the object files that form the import table entries, or we could</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// just look at the archive member names, for MSVC style import libraries.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Looking at the archive member names doesn&#39;t work for GNU style import</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// libraries though, while inspecting the import table entries works for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// both. (MSVC style import libraries contain a couple regular object files</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for the header/trailers.)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This implementation does the same as GNU dlltool does; look at the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// content of &quot;.idata$7&quot; sections, or for MSVC style libraries, look</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// at &quot;.idata$6&quot; sections.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For GNU style import libraries, there are also other data chunks in sections</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// named &quot;.idata$7&quot; (entries to the IAT or ILT); these are distinguished</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// by seeing that they contain relocations. (They also look like an empty</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// string when looking for null termination.)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Alternatively, we could do things differently - look for any .idata$2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// section; this would be import directory entries. At offset 12 in them</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// there is the RVA of the import DLL name; look for a relocation at this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// spot and locate the symbol that it points at. That symbol may either</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// be within the same object file (in the case of MSVC style import libraries)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// or another object file (in the case of GNU import libraries).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-dlltooldriver-cpp-/#ae6071096c441061cfc9f7b4cf8f4ec9e"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-dlltooldriver-cpp-/#ae6071096c441061cfc9f7b4cf8f4ec9e">identifyImportName</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/object/coffobjectfile">COFFObjectFile</a> &amp;Obj, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> ObjName,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="normal">                        std::vector&lt;StringRef&gt; &amp;Names, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IsMsStyleImplib) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> TargetName = IsMsStyleImplib ? </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;.idata$6&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;.idata$7&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;S : Obj.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/object/objectfile/#a7f73649118e365a230be4870d824e7cf">sections</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!E.ImportName.empty() || (!E.Name.empty() &amp;&amp; E.Name&#91;0&#93; == </Highlight><Highlight kind="charliteral">&#39;?&#39;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383"><Highlight kind="normal">      E.SymbolName = E.Name;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Trim off the trailing decoration. Symbols will always have a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// starting prefix here (either &#95; for cdecl/stdcall, @ for fastcall</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// or ? for C++ functions). Vectorcall functions won&#39;t have any</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// fixed prefix, but the function base name will still be at least</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// one char.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"><Highlight kind="normal">      E.Name = E.Name.substr(0, E.Name.find(</Highlight><Highlight kind="charliteral">&#39;@&#39;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, 1));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// By making sure E.SymbolName != E.Name for decorated symbols,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// writeImportLibrary writes these symbols with the type</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
